page.title: 07SHERE CHURCH 2
page.content: There are two chapels, St.Nicholas Chapel and the Bray Chapel. The St. Nicholas Chapel was built in the 14th century and the Bray Chapel contains the memorials to the Bray family who have been Lords of the Manor of Shere since 1487. On the north wall of the chancel can be seen the quatrefoil and squint which were part of a cell built on the outside of the church to house Christine Carpenter,an anchoress who was enclosed by permission of the Bishop of Winchester in 1329. The squint provided her with a view of the alter and through the quatrefoil she received communion. The cell itself has been demolished but its outlines can still be seen on the outside of the north wall. The church today is well attended,it has a choir and team of bell-ringers.
